just create a separate /home partition.
then you can nuke / re-install / change your distro whenever you want and not lose your user files.
then, if you want to back that stuff up, just use dd and dump it to a compressed file.
that's what I've done for years.
if you want to get really tricky, use LVM and setup Home and System volume groups, then you can dynamically adjust the filesystem size.
that's why you make backup copies onto the server. Don't rely 100% on your server because in that situation, the server HD is more likely to fail than the PCs.
use separate /home partitions and scheduled backups or distributed filesystems. that's your best bet.
